verses.verse: Confesse you [it] vnto God, call vppon his name: cause the people to vnderstande his deuises.
Sing vnto hym, sing psalmes vnto him: talke you of all his wonderous workes.
Glary ye in his holy name: let the heart of them reioyce that do seeke God.
Seeke God and his strength: seeke his face euermore.
Remember the meruaylous workes that he hath done: his wonders, and the iudgementes of his mouth.
O ye seede of Abraham his seruaunt, ye his chosen chyldren of Iacob:
(105:6) he is God our Lord, his iudgementes are in all the earth.
(105:7) He hath ben mindfull alwayes of his couenaunt (for he promised a worde to a thousande generations:)
(105:7) euen of his couenaunt that he made with Abraham, and of his othe vnto Isaac.
(105:8) And he appointed the same vnto Iacob for a law: and to Israel for an euerlasting couenaunt.
(105:9) Saying, vnto thee I wyll geue the lande of Chanaan: the lot of your inheritaunce.
(105:10) When they were a fewe men in number, and had ben straungers but a litle whyle in it:
(105:10) and when they went from one nation to another, from one kingdome to another people.
(105:11) He suffred no man to do them wrong: yea he reproued euen kynges for their sakes.
(105:12) Touche not mine annoynted: and triumph not ouer my prophetes.
(105:13) Moreouer he called for a famine vpon the lande: and he made all maner of foode to fayle.
(105:14) But he had sent a man before them: euen Ioseph, who was solde to be a bonde seruaunt.
(105:15) Whose feete they dyd hurt in the stockes: the iron entred into his soule.
(105:16) Vntill the tyme came that his cause [was knowen:] the worde of the Lorde tryed hym.
(105:17) The king sent and caused hym to be let go: yea the prince of the people opened a way foorth for hym.
(105:18) He made him Lorde of his house: and ruler of all his substaunce.
(105:19) That he might enfourme his princes according to his minde: and teache his senatours wysdome.
(105:20) Israel also came into Egypt: & Iacob was a straunger in the lande of Cham.
(105:21) And he encreased his people exceedinglye: and made them stronger then their enemies.
(105:22) Whose heart so turned that they hated his people: and dealt subtilly with his seruauntes.
(105:23) [Then] he sent Moyses his seruaunt, and Aaron whom he had chosen:
(105:23) they did their message, workyng his signes among them, and wonders in the lande of Cham.
(105:24) He sent darknes, & it was darke: and they went not from his wordes.
(105:25) He turned their waters into blood: and slue their fishe.
(105:26) Their lande brought foorth frogges: yea euen in their kinges chaumbers.
(105:27) He spake the worde, and there came a swarme of all maner of flyes: [and] of lyce in all their quarters.
(105:28) He gaue them haylestones for rayne: [and] flambes of fire in their lande.
(105:29) He smote their vines also & figge trees: and he destroyed the trees that were in their coastes.
(105:30) He spake the worde, and the grashoppers came: & caterpillers innumerable.
(105:31) And they did eate vp all the grasse in their lande: and deuoured the fruite of their grounde.
(105:32) He smote al the first borne in their land: euen the first fruites of all their concupiscence.
(105:33) He also brought them foorth with siluer and golde: there was not one feeble person in their tribes.
(105:34) Egypt was glad at their departing: for they were smytten with dread of them.
(105:35) He spred out a cloude to be a couering: and fire to geue light in the night season.
(105:36) The [people] required and he brought quayles: and he filled them with the bread of heauen.
(105:37) He opened the rocke of stone and the waters flowed out: so that streames ranne in drye places.
(105:38) For he remembred his holy worde: [spoken] vnto Abraham his seruaunt.
(105:39) And he brought foorth his people with gladnes: [and] his chosen with a ioyfull noyse.
(105:40) And he gaue them the landes of the Heathen, and they toke to inheritaunce the labours of the people.
(105:41) To the intent that they shoulde kepe his statutes: and obserue his lawes. Prayse ye the Lorde.
